text:
Hi Tosin!
I’m so sorry
I hadn’t seen this message (was also on holiday so didn’t have that much free time)
When I joined Escape I had zero knowledge of anything VFX related, I had played around with blender and done 3D stuff but had no idea the 2D side was there
Before joining I did both their taster courses, 3D and 2D and was completely sold on the 2D so am very very glad I made myself do both tasters before deciding
Escape helped me get a job in the sense that it gave me the knowledge I needed
I never used their showreel support or anything after finishing the course itself
When I did the course, Escape was a bit of a mess as it was being bought by Pearson which is why I didn’t get as much support as I’m sure you now get
Just having Escape on your CV is usually certification enough that you know what you’re doing or at least it used to
How’s the course going? How long have you started it and how long do you still have to go?
What subject are you on right now?

It's no problem at all!

Ahh really that good! I'm in second year so I still have one year to go. But this also being the second intake for the undergraduate course it's not exactly perfect either, but im am enjoying it and find it very useful.

I am currently on a team project module where 3D and 2D are working together to create 2-5 live action VFX shots, were only on the 4th week out of 11 weeks of the module, but to make progress faster I'm currently working on some 3d assets
